name: Pickthall
text: Alif. Lam. Ra. These are verse of the Scripture that maketh plain.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! We have revealed it, a Lecture in Arabic, that ye may understand.

name: Pickthall
text: We narrate unto thee (Muhammad) the best of narratives in that We have inspired in thee this Qur'an, though aforetime thou wast of the heedless.

name: Pickthall
text: When Joseph said unto his father: O my father! Lo! I saw in a dream eleven planets and the sun and the moon, I saw them prostrating themselves unto me.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: O my dear son! Tell not thy brethren of thy vision, lest they plot a plot against thee. Lo! Satan is for man an open foe.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus thy Lord will prefer thee and will teach thee the interpretation of events, and will perfect His grace upon thee and upon the family of Jacob as He perfected it upon thy forefathers, Abraham and Isaac. Lo! thy Lord is Knower, Wise.

name: Pickthall
text: Verily in Joseph and his brethren are signs (of Allah's Sovereignty) for the inquiring.

name: Pickthall
text: When they said: Verily Joseph and his brother are dearer to our father than we are, many though we be. Lo! our father is in plain aberration.

name: Pickthall
text: (One said): Kill Joseph or cast him to some (other) land, so that your father's favour may be all for you, and (that) ye may afterward be righteous folk.

name: Pickthall
text: One among them said: Kill not Joseph but, if ye must be doing, fling him into the depth of the pit; some caravan will find him.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: O our father! Why wilt thou not trust us with Joseph, when lo! we are good friends to him?

name: Pickthall
text: Send him with us to-morrow that he may enjoy himself and play. And lo! we shall take good care of him.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Lo! in truth it saddens me that ye should take him with you, and I fear less the wolf devour him while ye are heedless of him.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: If the wolf should devour him when we are (so strong) a band, then surely we should have already perished.

name: Pickthall
text: Then, when they led him off, and were of one mind that they should place him in the depth of the pit, We inspired in him: Thou wilt tell them of this deed of theirs when they know (thee) not.

name: Pickthall
text: And they came weeping to their father in the evening.

name: Pickthall
text: Saying: O our father! We went racing one with another, and left Joseph by our things, and the wolf devoured him, and thou believest not our saying even when we speak the truth.

name: Pickthall
text: And they came with false blood on his shirt. He said: Nay, but your minds have beguiled you into something. (My course is) comely patience. And Allah it is Whose help is to be sought in that (predicament) which ye describe.

name: Pickthall
text: And there came a caravan, and they sent their waterdrawer. He let down his pail (into the pit). He said: Good luck! Here is a youth. And they hid him as a treasure, and Allah was Aware of what they did.

name: Pickthall
text: And they sold him for a low price, a number of silver coins; and they attached no value to him.

name: Pickthall
text: And he of Egypt who purchased him said unto his wife: Receive him honourably. Perchance he may prove useful to us or we may adopt him as a son. Thus we established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah was predominant in His career, but most of mankind know not.

name: Pickthall
text: And And when he reached his prime We gave him wisdom and knowledge. Thus We reward the good.

name: Pickthall
text: And she, in whose house he was, asked of him an evil act. She bolted the doors and said: Come! He said: I seek refuge in Allah! Lo! he is my lord, who hath treated me honourably. Lo! wrong-doers never prosper.

name: Pickthall
text: She verily desired him, and he would have desired her if it had not been that he saw the argument of his Lord. Thus it was, that We might ward off from him evil and lewdness. Lo! he was of Our chosen slaves.

name: Pickthall
text: And they raced with one another to the door, and she tore his shirt from behind, and they met her lord and master at the door. She said: What shall be his reward, who wisheth evil to thy folk, save prison or a painful doom?

name: Pickthall
text: (Joseph) said: She it was who asked of me an evil act. And a witness of her own folk testified: If his shirt is torn from before, then she speaketh truth and he is of the liars.

name: Pickthall
text: And if his shirt is torn from behind, then she hath lied and he is of the truthful.

name: Pickthall
text: So when he saw his shirt torn from behind, he said: Lo! this is of the guile of you women. Lo! the guile of you is very great.

name: Pickthall
text: O Joseph! Turn away from this, and thou, (O woman), ask forgiveness for thy sin. Lo! thou art of the faulty.

name: Pickthall
text: And women in the city said: The ruler's wife is asking of her slave-boy an ill-deed. Indeed he has smitten her to the heart with love. We behold her in plain aberration.

name: Pickthall
text: And when she heard of their sly talk, she sent to them and prepared for them a cushioned couch (to lie on at the feast) and gave to every one of them a knife and said (to Joseph): Come out unto them! And when they saw him they exalted him and cut their hands, exclaiming: Allah Blameless! This is no a human being. This is not other than some gracious angel.

name: Pickthall
text: She said: This is he on whose account ye blamed me. I asked of him an evil act, but he proved continent, but if he do not my behest he verily shall be imprisoned, and verily shall be of those brought low.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: O my Lord! Prison is more dear than that unto which they urge me, and if Thou fend not off their wiles from me I shall incline unto them and become of the foolish.

name: Pickthall
text: So his Lord heard his prayer and fended off their wiles from him. Lo! He is Hearer, Knower.

name: Pickthall
text: And it seemed good to them (the men-folk) after they had seen the signs (of his innocence) to imprison him for a time.

name: Pickthall
text: And two young men went to prison with him. One of them said: I dreamed that I was pressing wine. The other said: I dreamed that I was carrying upon my head bread whereof the birds were eating. Announce unto us the interpretation, for we see thee of those good (at interpretation).

name: Pickthall
text: He said: The food which ye are given (daily) shall not come unto you but I shall tell you the interpretation ere it cometh unto you. This is of that which my Lord hath taught me. Lo! I have forsaken the religion of folk who believe not in Allah and are disbelievers in the Hereafter.

name: Pickthall
text: And I have followed the religion of my fathers, Abraham and Isaac and Jacob. It never was for us to attribute aught as partner to Allah. This is of the bounty of Allah unto us (the seed of Abraham) and unto mankind; but most men give not thanks.

name: Pickthall
text: O my fellow-prisoners! Are divers lords better, or Allah the One, Almighty?

name: Pickthall
text: Those whom ye worship beside Him are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers. Allah hath revealed no sanction for them. The decision rests with Allah only, Who hath commanded you that ye worship none save Him. This is the right religion, but most men know not.

name: Pickthall
text: O my two fellow-prisoners! As for one of you, he will pour out wine for his lord to drink; and as for the other, he will be crucified so that the birds will eat from his head. Thus is the case judged concerning which ye did inquire.

name: Pickthall
text: And he said unto him of the twain who he knew would be released: Mention me in the presence of thy lord. But Satan caused him to forget to mention it to his lord, so he (Joseph) stayed in prison for some years.

name: Pickthall
text: And the king said: Lo! I saw in a dream seven fat kine which seven lean were eating, and seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry. O notables! Expound for me my vision, if ye can interpret dreams.

name: Pickthall
text: They answered: Jumbled dreams! And we are not knowing in the interpretation of dreams.

name: Pickthall
text: And he of the two who was released, and (now) at length remembered, said: I am going to announce unto you the interpretation, therefore send me forth.

name: Pickthall
text: (And when he came to Joseph in the prison, he exclaimed): Joseph! O thou truthful one! Expound for us the seven fat kine which seven lean were eating and the seven green ears of corn and other (seven) dry, that I may return unto the people, so that they may know.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Ye shall sow seven years as usual, but that which ye reap, leave it in the ear, all save a little which ye eat.

name: Pickthall
text: Then after that will come seven hard years which will devour all that ye have prepared for them, save a little of that which ye have stored.

name: Pickthall
text: Then, after that, will come a year when the people will have plenteous crops and when they will press (wine and oil).

name: Pickthall
text: And the king said: Bring him unto me. And when the messenger came unto him, he (Joseph) said: Return unto thy lord and ask him what was the case of the women who cut their hands. Lo! my Lord knoweth their guile.

name: Pickthall
text: He (the king) (then sent for those women and) said: What happened when ye asked an evil act of Joseph? They answered: Allah Blameless! We know no evil of him. Said the wife of the ruler: Now the truth is out. I asked of him an evil act, and he is surely of the truthful.

name: Pickthall
text: (Then Joseph said: I asked for) this, that he (my lord) may know that I betrayed him not in secret, and that surely Allah guideth not the snare of the betrayers.

name: Pickthall
text: I do not exculpate myself. Lo! the (human) soul enjoineth unto evil, save that whereon my Lord hath mercy. Lo! my Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: And the king said: Bring him unto me that I may attach him to my person. And when he had talked with him he said: Lo! thou art to-day in our presence established and trusted.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Set me over the storehouses of the land. Lo! I am a skilled custodian.

name: Pickthall
text: Thus gave We power to Joseph in the land. He was the owner of it where he pleased. We reach with Our mercy whom We will. We lose not the reward of the good.

name: Pickthall
text: And the reward of the Hereafter is better, for those who believe and ward off (evil).

name: Pickthall
text: And Joseph's brethren came and presented themselves before him, and he knew them but they knew him not.

name: Pickthall
text: And when he provided them with their provision he said: Bring unto me a brother of yours from your father. See ye not that I fill up the measure and I am the best of hosts?

name: Pickthall
text: And if ye bring him not unto me, then there shall be no measure for you with me, nor shall ye draw near.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We will try to win him from his father: that we will surely do.

name: Pickthall
text: He said unto his young men: Place their merchandise in their saddlebags, so that they may know it when they go back to their folk, and so will come again.

name: Pickthall
text: So when they went back to their father they said: O our father! The measure is denied us, so send with us our brother that we may obtain the measure, surely we will guard him well.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Can I entrust him to you save as I entrusted his brother to you aforetime? Allah is better at guarding, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.

name: Pickthall
text: And when they opened their belongings they discovered that their merchandise had been returned to them. They said: O our father! What (more) can we ask? Here is our merchandise returned to us. We shall get provision for our folk and guard our brother, and we shall have the extra measure of a camel (load). This (that we bring now) is a light measure.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: I will not send him with you till ye give me an undertaking in the name of Allah that ye will bring him back to me, unless ye are surrounded. And when they gave him their undertaking he said: Allah is the Warden over what we say.

name: Pickthall
text: And he said: O my sons! Go not in by one gate; go in by different gates. I can naught avail you as against Allah. Lo! the decision rests with Allah only. In Him do I put my trust, and in Him let all the trusting put their trust.

name: Pickthall
text: And when they entered in the manner which their father had enjoined, it would have naught availed them as against Allah; it was but a need of Jacob's soul which he thus satisfied; and lo! he was a lord of knowledge because We had taught him; but most of mankind know not.

name: Pickthall
text: And when they went in before Joseph, he took his brother unto him, saying: Lo! I, even I, am thy brother, therefore sorrow not for what they did.

name: Pickthall
text: And when he provided them with their provision, he put the drinking-cup in his brother's saddlebag, and then a crier cried: O camel-riders! Lo! ye are surely thieves!

name: Pickthall
text: They cried, coming toward them: What is it ye have lost?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: We have lost the king's cup, and he who bringeth it shall have a camel-load, and I (said Joseph) am answerable for it.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: By Allah, well ye know we came not to do evil in the land, and are no thieves.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: And what shall be the penalty for it, if ye prove liars?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: The penalty for it! He in whose bag (the cup) is found, he is the penalty for it. Thus we requite wrong-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: Then he (Joseph) began the search with their bags before his brother's bag, then he produced it from his brother's bag. Thus did We contrive for Joseph. He could not have taken his brother according to the king's law unless Allah willed. We raise by grades (of mercy) whom We will, and over every lord of knowledge there is one more knowing.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: If he stealeth, a brother of his stole before. But Joseph kept it secret in his soul and revealed it not unto them. He said (within himself): Ye are in worse case, and Allah knoweth best (the truth of) that which ye allege.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: O ruler of the land! Lo! he hath a very aged father, so take one of us instead of him. Lo! we behold thee of those who do kindness.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Allah forbid that we should seize save him with whom we found our property; then truly we should be wrong-doers.

name: Pickthall
text: So, When they despaired of (moving) him, they conferred together apart. The eldest of them said: Know ye not how your father took an undertaking from you in Allah's name and how ye failed in the case of Joseph aforetime? Therefore I shall not go forth from the land until my father giveth leave or Allah judgeth for me. He is the Best of Judges.

name: Pickthall
text: Return unto your father and say: O our father! Lo! thy son hath stolen. We testify only to that which we know; we are not guardians of the Unseen.

name: Pickthall
text: Ask the township where we were, and the caravan with which we travelled hither. Lo! we speak the truth.

name: Pickthall
text: (And when they came unto their father and had spoken thus to him) he said: Nay, but your minds have beguiled you into something. (My course is) comely patience! It may be that Allah will bring them all unto me. Lo! He, only He, is the Knower, the Wise.

name: Pickthall
text: And he turned away from them and said: Alas, my grief for Joseph! And his eyes were whitened with the sorrow that he was suppressing.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: By Allah, thou wilt never cease remembering Joseph till thy health is ruined or thou art of those who perish!

name: Pickthall
text: He said: I expose my distress and anguish only unto Allah, and I know from Allah that which ye know not.

name: Pickthall
text: Go, O my sons, and ascertain concerning Joseph and his brother, and despair not of the Spirit of Allah. Lo! none despaireth of the Spirit of Allah save disbelieving folk.

name: Pickthall
text: And when they came (again) before him (Joseph) they said: O ruler! Misfortune hath touched us and our folk, and we bring but poor merchandise, so fill for us the measure and be charitable unto us. Lo! Allah will requite the charitable,

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Know ye what ye did unto Joseph and his brother in your ignorance?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: Is it indeed thou who art Joseph? He said: I am Joseph and this is my brother. Allah hath shown us favour. Lo! he who wardeth off (evil) and endureth (findeth favour); for lo! Allah loseth not the wages of the kindly.

name: Pickthall
text: They said: By Allah, verily Allah hath preferred thee above us, and we were indeed sinful.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: Have no fear this day! May Allah forgive you, and He is the Most Merciful of those who show mercy.

name: Pickthall
text: Go with this shirt of mine and lay it on my father's face, he will become (again) a seer; and come to me with all your folk.

name: Pickthall
text: When the caravan departed their father had said: Truly I am conscious of the breath of Joseph, though ye call me dotard.

name: Pickthall
text: (Those around him) said: By Allah, lo! thou art in thine old aberration.

name: Pickthall
text: Then, when the bearer of glad tidings came, he laid it on his face and he became a seer once more. He said: Said I not unto you that I know from Allah that which ye know not?

name: Pickthall
text: They said: O our father! Ask forgiveness of our sins for us, for lo! we were sinful.

name: Pickthall
text: He said: I shall ask forgiveness for you of my Lord. Lo! He is the Forgiving, the Merciful.

name: Pickthall
text: And when they came in before Joseph, he took his parents unto him, and said: Come into Egypt safe, if Allah will!

name: Pickthall
text: And he placed his parents on the dais and they fell down before him prostrate, and he said: O my father! This is the interpretation of my dream of old. My Lord hath made it true, and He hath shown me kindness, since He took me out of the prison and hath brought you from the desert after Satan had made strife between me and my brethren. Lo! my Lord is tender unto whom He will. He is the Knower, the Wise.

name: Pickthall
text: O my Lord! Thou hast given me (something) of sovereignty and hast taught me (something) of the interpretation of events - Creator of the heavens and the earth! Thou art my Protecting Guardian in the world and the Hereafter. Make me to die muslim (unto Thee), and join me to the righteous.

name: Pickthall
text: This is of the tidings of the Unseen which We inspire in thee (Muhammad). Thou wast not present with them when they fixed their plan and they were scheming.

name: Pickthall
text: And though thou try much, most men will not believe.

name: Pickthall
text: Thou askest them no fee for it. It is naught else than a reminder unto the peoples.

name: Pickthall
text: How many a portent is there in the heavens and the earth which they pass by with face averted!

name: Pickthall
text: And most of them believe not in Allah except that they attribute partners (unto Him).

name: Pickthall
text: Deem they themselves secure from the coming on them of a pall of Allah's punishment, or the coming of the Hour suddenly while they are unaware?

name: Pickthall
text: Say: This is my Way: I call on Allah with sure knowledge. I and whosoever followeth me - Glory be to Allah! - and I am not of the idolaters.

name: Pickthall
text: We sent not before thee (any messengers) save men whom We inspired from among the folk of the townships - Have they not travelled in the land and seen the nature of the consequence for those who were before them? And verily the abode of the Hereafter, for those who ward off (evil), is best. Have ye then no sense? -

name: Pickthall
text: Till, when the messengers despaired and thought that they were denied, then came unto them Our help, and whom We would was saved. And Our wrath cannot be warded from the guilty.

name: Pickthall
text: In their history verily there is a lesson for men of understanding. It is no invented story but a confirmation of the existing (Scripture) and a detailed explanation of everything, and a guidance and a mercy for folk who believe.
